channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: On pavement outside 49 Heath Street, 5th January
item.description:
The cover of the rain water gutter is missing and appears to have been damaged by vehicles parking on the pavement. It needs repairing as it is currently a trip hazard for pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heath Street, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Icy roads, 5th January
item.description:
Br53wb roads are extremely icy and need urgent gritting
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102, Brantwood Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped from the flats, 5th January
item.description:
Attached photo is rubbish that has been dumped from the flats. Looks like someone is gutting the flat and dumping the rubbish outside. People dumping the rubbish have been approached and asked when it will be removed but they choose to ignore you. Something needs to be done otherwise the problem will get worse as others will think they can dump their rubbish. Out streets should not be in this state.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orange Place, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags from Sunday market left in front of the vets, 5th January
item.description:
Please see the photo of the rubbish bags left in front of our veterinary surgery from the Sunday market on Railton Rd. The address is 224-228 Railton Rd.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 309, Railton Road, Herne Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on street, 5th January
item.description:
Park Ave has not been cleaned for at least 2 weeks and is covered in rubbish.especially near the top at Green Lanes. This problem made worse by overflowing bins and rubbish blowing down from Green Lanes

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Avenue, Palmers Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Icy pathways, 5th January
item.description:
The pathways/walkways on duddington close are very icy, have cause a person to fall already, and are in need of gritting. Can this be done for the residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duddington Close, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1 Holly Hill, 5th January
item.description:
As per your response to FixMyStreet ref: 7862601, the deadline of six months you stated has now passed and Thames Water have not been back to carry out permanent reinstatement. Please conform that you will address this issue asap? Please confirm receipt of this message.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Holly Hill, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on concrete fence, 5th January
item.description:
Graffiti has been put on the concrete fence. This is very visible from the road, park users and may attract further vandalism. I am not sure what the content means and do not want to deter people from using the park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Way, Barnes Cray, Greater London

item.title: Danger: broken branch above the sidewalk, 5th January
item.description:
A very large branch has broken off and is now dangling from another branch. It's hanging just above the pavement (sidewalk). It could take only a gust of wind to make it fall on a passer-by. This would cause serious injuries. This branch needs to be removed urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springfield Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
